qas.question: What global agreement gives sovereign national rights over biological resources?
What agreement commits countries to conserve biodiversity?
What agreement commits countries to develop resources for sustainability?
What is the process of collecting natural products?
What global agreement gives sovereign national rights over private resources?
What agreement commits countries to conserve bioprospecting?
What agreement commits countries to develop resources for biopiracy?
What is the process of collecting national rights?
What do countries that allow natural agreements expect?

context: Global agreements such as <a0_0><a1_0><a2_0><b4_0><b5_0><b6_0>the Convention on Biological Diversity<b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/><a2_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/>, give "sovereign national rights over biological resources" (not property). The agreements commit countries to "conserve biodiversity", "develop resources for sustainability" and "share the benefits" resulting from their use. Biodiverse countries that allow <a3_0>bioprospecting<a3_0/> or collection of natural products, expect <b8_0>a share of the benefits<b8_0/> rather than allowing the individual or institution that discovers/exploits the resource to capture them privately. <b7_0>Bioprospecting<b7_0/> can become a type of biopiracy when such principles are not respected.[citation needed]
